overview: Vote Leave campaign claimed leaving the EU would save Â£350 million per week for the NHS.
furtherDescription: This figure was printed on the side of the Vote Leave campaign bus, becoming one of the most controversial claims.

overview: Remain campaign argued Brexit would cause an immediate economic shock.
furtherDescription: Chancellor George Osborne warned of a 'DIY recession' if Britain left the EU.

overview: Nigel Farage claimed Brexit would allow the UK to take back control of its borders.
furtherDescription: This was a central message of the Leave campaign, focusing heavily on immigration.

overview: David Cameron argued leaving the EU would threaten national security.
furtherDescription: Cameron suggested that EU membership allowed Britain to work more closely with European allies against terrorism.

overview: Vote Leave highlighted potential trade deals with non-EU countries.
furtherDescription: Leave campaigners argued that the UK could negotiate better trade deals independently.

overview: Remain campaign emphasised freedom of movement benefits for young people.
furtherDescription: They argued that staying in the EU guaranteed British citizens the right to work, study, and travel across Europe.

overview: Michael Gove said Brexit would restore sovereignty to the UK Parliament.
furtherDescription: He claimed too many decisions were being made in Brussels rather than Westminster.

overview: Barack Obama warned the UK would be 'at the back of the queue' for trade deals if it left the EU.
furtherDescription: The US President intervened during his state visit, sparking controversy among Leave supporters.

overview: Boris Johnson argued that the EU was undermining democracy.
furtherDescription: Johnson suggested that decisions affecting Britain should not be made by unelected EU bureaucrats.

overview: Remain campaign launched warnings of house price falls and job losses if Brexit happened.
furtherDescription: Opponents of Brexit argued that leaving would destabilise the housing market and increase unemployment.
